org.jasig.cas.ticket.support

Class ThrottledUseAndTimeoutExpirationPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.ticket.support.AbstractCasExpirationPolicy
      • org.jasig.cas.ticket.support.ThrottledUseAndTimeoutExpirationPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ExpirationPolicy

    @Component(value="throttledUseAndTimeoutExpirationPolicy")
public final class ThrottledUseAndTimeoutExpirationPolicy
extends AbstractCasExpirationPolicy
    Implementation of an expiration policy that adds the concept of saying that a ticket can only be used once every X milliseconds to prevent misconfigured clients from consuming resources by doing constant redirects.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public boolean isExpired(TicketState ticketState)
        Description copied from interface: ExpirationPolicy
        Method to determine if a Ticket has expired or not, based on the policy.
        Parameters:
        ticketState - The snapshot of the current ticket state
        Returns:
        true if the ticket is expired, false otherwise.

      • getTimeToLive

        public java.lang.Long getTimeToLive()
        Description copied from interface: ExpirationPolicy
        Describes the time duration where this policy should consider the item alive. Once this time passes, the item is considered expired and dead.
        Returns:
        alive time in seconds. A zero value indicates the time duration is not supported or is inactive.

      • getTimeToIdle

        public java.lang.Long getTimeToIdle()
        Description copied from interface: ExpirationPolicy
        Describes the idle time duration for the item.
        Returns:
        idle time in seconds. A zero value indicates the time duration is not supported or is inactive.
